sect3.title: Overview

row.entry: This tool is used for crop, rotate and prespective correction of you image, it does also include many helpful guidelines that assists you using the tool.

sect3.para: First off select what aspect ratio you want and size the crop bounds by dragging border and corner handles, use ctrl-x to swap potrait/landscape rotation of the crop rectangle. You can move around the crop rectangle by holding down left mouse button and move around... When you finished and want to execute the crop, hit enter key or double click in crop rectangle.

sect4.title: Flip image
sect4.para: Use these toggle buttons to flip image horizontal and veritcal

sect4.title: Angle
sect4.para: This is the angle for rotation, used for correctiion for example a non straight horizontal horizon, use your left mouse button holding it down and drawing a line along the horizon and the image are rotated to match the angle of your line.

sect4.title: Perspective
sect4.para: This tool is used for correcting any perspective distortions in you image, like example when you shoot an high building from ground and aiming upwards with camera with short focal length...
You can also choose which direction (righ and up) the correction should be applied on.

sect4.title: Aspect
sect4.para: Here you can change what aspect ratio you want to have on the result, constraining the ability to drag an crop rectangle out of the aspect ratio of your choice..

row.entry: free forming the rectangle without any ratio restrictions
this option constrains the ratio to be equal to image ratio
